item.title: Soulmask: Where to Find Worship Containers
item.description:
Quick Links

  • What Are Worship Containers In Soulmask?
  • How To Find Worship Contains In Soulmask

Soulmask follows the story of the player character who escapes a sacrificial ritual. During their escape, they come across an Ancient Mask with mystical powers that can help them survive in this world they've been forced into. This is great because the mask can go a long way in helping players, especially if they pick the right starting mask.

While exploring this new world, players will need to figure out the best way to survive in the harsh reality. In order to do that, players will need to be prepared to take on difficult enemies, and some of those enemies may drop Worship Containers. Here's how to get these Worship Containers and what to do with them once players have found them.

What Are Worship Containers In Soulmask?

Worship Containers are an item that players can find. Their in-game description reads, "A container used for worship rituals. Can summon special creatures, obtainable from Tribal Barracks bosses." They can summon Temple Guardians , which are difficult enemies that protect specific Ancient Pyramids . (Players will need other items to summon the Temple Guardians, and what items are needed depends on the one they are summoning.) Here are all the Temple Guardians that they can summon:

  • Saber-Toothed Predator - Rainforest Pyramid
  • Fogfrog - Hill Pyramid
  • Vajra Ape - Plateau Pyramid
  • Tempest Griffin - Desert Pyramid
  • Mammoth - Snow Mountain Pyramid

Once these Temple Guardians are summoned, each one will have three different levels, and each level will be increasingly more difficult than the last one.

The Temple Guardians are an excellent source of Blue Crystals, and the chests in the Ancient Pyramids hold amazing loot.

How To Find Worship Contains In Soulmask

Since Worship Containers are so valuable, finding them in the game can be a bit difficult. Players will need to defeat high-level enemies from hostile tribes. These enemies can be Tribe Chiefs or Tribe Leaders (which can be found within the Barbarian Barracks, the same place players can find cotton). This is only one of the things these enemies drop, meaning it isn't guaranteed that players will obtain one by killing them.

Additionally, there is a slight chance that they can drop from Outcasts and Plunderers (specifically those that are Elite versions of those enemies). These enemies can be found within Ancient Ruins and can be pretty difficult to kill. Just like with the Tribe Chiefs and Tribe Leaders, players won't be guaranteed to obtain a Worship Container from killing these enemies. They will need to work hard to obtain these items.

item.title: What's The Best Way To Get Ammo In Fallout 76?
item.description:
Quick Links

  • How To Get Ammo In Fallout 76
  • Best Way To Farm Ammo In Fallout 76

Ammo is vital in Fallout 76. Almost every player in the game relies on some sort of ammo to take down enemies. Ammo can sometimes be tricky to come by, especially for those who don't have a Fallout 1st subscription, as they are limited when it comes to how much can be stored in a stashbox.

New players, in particular, may struggle to find ammo, especially early on. However, there are a few sure-fire methods of farming ammo that are great for players of all levels. From passive ammo generation to missions that give players lots of extra ammo, there are a few things that players can do to ensure that they never run out of ammo again.

How To Get Ammo In Fallout 76

There Are Lots of Ways To Obtain Ammo

Fallout 76 gives players lots of different ways to find, earn, and craft ammo. For the most part, players will use a combination of all methods to keep stocked up on ammo. Here's a list of every possible way that you can obtain ammo in Fallout 76:

  • Crafting ammo at a Tinker's Workbench
  • Buying ammo from other players
  • Buying ammo from robot vendors
  • Buying Ammo From Ammo Machines
  • Finding ammo while looting
  • Looting ammo from corpses
  • Being awarded ammo for completing missions, quests, and events
  • Using an ammo converter machine (swaps ammo from one type to another)
  • Completing Expeditions
  • Completing Daily Ops

There is one other way that you can get ammo that wasn't listed above: using the Armco Ammunition Construction Appliance. This is a CAMP item that will passively generate ammo at your base. It's important to note that you can only obtain the plan to craft this item after reaching the max reputation rank with the raiders . Then, you can buy the plan to build this from Mortimer in the Crater for 750 Gold Bullion.

Best Way To Farm Ammo In Fallout 76

Uplink Daily Ops

It's important to note that completing Expeditions is a close second, but Daily Ops are the best way to farm ammo in Fallout 76. Like with most kills, each downed enemy will have some ammo on them. The ammo type will match your weapon, with the exception of things like Plasma Cores. Because Daily Ops spawn in loads of enemies, they're a fantastic way of getting lots of ammo fast.

While you will also get some ammo for completing a Daily Operation, it can often be better not to complete the mission. Instead, start the Daily Op and simply go around killing endless waves of enemies. Just note that this only works for Uplink Daily Operations . Also, if you choose to do this, don't start a team, as other players may join who may actually want to complete the Daily Op. Just head into one alone.

With a good build and some patience, it's possible to pick up thousands of bullets per hour while grinding Daily Ops.

item.title: Fallout 4: How to Use Weather Change Shells
item.description:
Fallout 4 added settlement building to the franchise for the first time. You can create a bustling city filled with settlers or a heavily fortified vault. The game received a few workshop DLCs after release that added even more items and machines that you can make.

The weather randomly cycles as you explore the Commonwealth, bringing conditions including clear skies, rain, and radstorms. Radstorms will make the landscape a sickly shade of green and build up RADs as you explore in the now toxic environment. Weather Change Shells were added in the Contraption Workshops DLC. Here is how you can use them and change the weather to your liking in Fallout 4.

How to Change the Weather in Fallout 4

Build a Generator

The first step is building a generator in your settlement, which will give power to any devices that you attach them to. Larger generators create more power but take more materials to build, but you only need a Small Generator to use the shells. Here are the requirements to build one. Trashcan Carla is a vendor who regularly travels through Sanctuary Hills and is a good resource for most junk you may need.

Generator - Small

  • Two Gear
  • Four Steel
  • Two Rubber
  • Two Copper
  • One Ceramic

Build a Firework Mortar

Open your workshop menu and go to the miscellaneous section of power. Here you can find firework mortars, which are angled mortars that shoot straight up. Both take the same materials and will work for Weather Change Shells.

Firework Mortar

  • Two Wood
  • Two Steel
  • One Asbestos

Once you've made the firework mortar, attach it to the generator to give it power. Highlight the generator and press the Triangle/Y button to drag the wire to the mortar.

Craft Weather Change Shells

There are three types of shells that you can make. These are Clear, Radstorm, and Rain Shells, which you can craft at any Chemistry Station.

Weather Change Shell - Clear

  • One Adhesive
  • One Cloth
  • One Fertilizer
  • One Gold

Weather Change Shell - Radstorm

  • One Adhesive
  • One Cloth
  • One Fertilizer
  • One Nuclear Material

Weather Change Shell - Rain

  • One Adhesive
  • One Cloth
  • One Fertilizer
  • One Silver

How to Use Weather Change Shells in Fallout 4

Now that you've made the shells, it's time to fire them into the sky. Walk up to the mortar and press the Square/X button to transfer items. The shells will be in the My Misc tab of your inventory. Insert the shells into the firework mortar and enjoy your weather of choice.

item.title: Cult of the Lamb Update Adding Major New Feature
item.description:
Highlights

  • Cult of the Lamb's Unholy Alliance update on August 12 adds co-op play, new powers, and other additions for solo play.
  • The rogue-like game has received free content updates, keeping gameplay fresh and engaging for players since its 2022 launch.
  • With local co-op multiplayer and ongoing developer support, Cult of the Lamb continues to evolve and grow in popularity.

During Devolver Digital's Devolver Direct on June 7, a new Cult of the Lamb update was announced for August 12 featuring co-op multiplayer. Cult of the Lamb is a rogue-like where players take control of a sacrificial lamb in charge of a cult dedicated to a being known as "The One Who Waits." Since the game's release, developer Massive Monster has continued to support the game with free content updates. The update announced at the Devolver Direct marks the game's third free content update.

Cult of the Lamb has received sizable content updates since its launch in 2022, keeping the game fresh and giving players a reason to keep coming back to the rogue-like. Cult of the Lamb's first update is called "Relics of the Old Faith." This update focused primarily on expanding the game's combat. The second and most substantial update to the Cult of the Lamb so far is called "Sins of the Flesh." This update added new features, items, and quests for the player to take on.

Now, the Unholy Alliance update is bringing co-op multiplayer to Cult of the Lamb , as announced during the Devolver Direct on June 7. This announcement comes off of the heels of the Cult of the Lamb comic being announced. Once the update launches, players will be able to team-up with a friend to experience Cult of the Lamb together. One player will take control of the titular lamb while a second player controls a new goat character. By playing together, the game introduces new twists on mini-games and switches up gameplay. The Lamb and the Goat are able to switch weapons mid-combat. And if both players fight in sync, they are able to deal bonus damage.

Unholy Alliance Adding More than Just Co-Op

In addition to co-op, Unholy Alliance also adds new powers and abilities for solo players to enjoy. Also included will be "new tarot cards, relics, buildings, fleeces, follower traits, follower quests, and other secrets to discover,” according to a press release from Devolver Digital. The co-op being added to Cult of the Lamb is restricted to local co-op only, with no indication of online co-op being added at a later date. Massive Monster is sure to continue supporting Cult of the Lamb for the foreseeable future. With this being the second update of 2024 following Cult of the Lamb's Sins of the Flesh update in January, there is always more potential for content to be added to Cult of the Lamb . The developers have been taking fan feedback and adding to the game since its launch, leading to it becoming one of Devolver Digital's bestselling games.

Cult of the Lamb received rave reviews when it released in 2022, and Unholy Alliance looks to improve upon the game even further. Cult of the Lamb 's Unholy Alliance update launches on August 12. Players will be able to take control of the Lamb and the Goat and lead their cult to success together.

item.title: Dragon Age: Strongest Shapeshifters, Ranked
item.description:
Bioware's Dragon Age franchise is a franchise beloved for its rich worldbuilding and storytelling, strong focus on fully realized characters and their interactions, and its delightful use of fantastical magic to enhance the setting and add depth to the lore.

Mages in the world of Thedas are feared for the truly vast array of magics that are potentially theirs to command, with many examples of mages turning to forbidden or dangerous magic throughout the history of the world. Some of the most feared mages in the Dragon Age franchise are shapeshifters. Here the most powerful shapeshifters known in the world of Thedas and in the Dragon Age setting.

8 Frenic

Blood Mage Cultist

Encountered during Dragon Age: Dawn of the Seeker , Frenic is a blood mage, cultist, and shapeshifter involved in a conspiracy.

A powerful mage, Frenic is shown transforming into a raven and, later, into a pride demon. Frenic is ultimately defeated by Cassandra Pentaghast, protagonist of Dragon Age: Dawn of the Seeker , and later companion to the Inquisitor in Dragon Age: Inquisition .

7 Yavana

The Witch of the Weyrs

One of the mysterious daughters of Flemeth, Yavana is a witch who resides in the Silent Grove as a tender of dragons. A powerful magic user, Yavana was trained by her mother in the arts of magic and more specifically shapeshifting.

Encountered in the comic Dragon Age: Silent Grove , Yavana is a conservationist who wants to preserve dragons from overhunting by humans.

6 The Warden Commander

The Orlesian Warden

A possible player character in Dragon Age: Origins - Awakening, the expansion for Dragon Age: Origins, The Warden Commander is an Orlesian Grey Warden who may be of any sex or race. Appointed the Arl of Amaranthine with the task of rebuilding the Grey Wardens in Ferelden, The Warden Commander can be of any character class.

If the player so chooses, the Warden Commander can be a mage with the shapeshifter specialization. The Warden Commander is a powerful character with a string of accolades to their name, making them one of the more powerful shapeshifters in the Dragon Age setting.

5 The Grey Warden

The Hero of Ferelden

The player character of Dragon Age: Origins , the Grey Warden makes for a very powerful mage with access to a wide variety of different spells and class specializations. The Grey Warden is a powerful figure in Thedas, overcoming much adversity throughout the events of Dragon Age: Origins to stop the Blight afflicting Ferelden - all the while becoming embroiled in political schemes and chaos.

A mage Grey Warden can learn the shapeshifter specialization which, paired with powers available to the player, makes them a force to be reckoned with and one of Thedas's most powerful shapeshifters.

4 Morrigan

The Other Witch of the Wilds

One of many daughters of Flemeth, the ancient Witch of the Wilds, Morrigan is a player companion first encountered during Dragon Age: Origins and who has a major role in the lore of the series moving forward. Prickly and abrasive, Morrigan is more complex than many first assume, and has a troubled relationship with her mother.

But Morrigan is a highly skilled and talented mage, called a witch by the Circle of Magi, and has access to magic unknown to many of the more 'civilized' mages. She is one of the most powerful shapeshifters in Thedas, and has knowledge of deeper and more arcane magical arts than many will ever encounter.

3 The Evanuris

The Elven Gods

Great and powerful elven heroes and generals from a time long, long before the rise of humanity, the Evanuris are worshiped as gods by the modern Dalish elves. In their own time, they were said to be the most powerful of all the elves, revered and eventually treated as gods, coming to command the entire society of elves in the days of Elvhenan.

In those days, the Veil separating Thedas from the Fade didn't exist, so the ancient elves had a very different relationship with magic and the physical world. The Evanuris were grandmasters in the use of magic and had associations with animals in the modern day of Thedas. Mythal, one of the most well-known of the Evanuris, is a known shapeshifter, suggesting this was a common skill among them.

2 Flemeth

The Witch of the Wilds

Flemeth is an extremely powerful and ancient witch, a kind of mage trained outside of the formal Circles of Magi. Known by many names over the centuries, the player first encounters Flemeth in the form of an old woman during Dragon Age: Origins . Although somewhat rude, Flemeth is shown to be knowledgeable and possessed of information vital to the player's journey, and she even commands her daughter Morrigan to accompany the player.

It's later revealed that Flemeth is far more than she first seemed, making appearances in both Dragon Age 2 and Dragon Age: Inquisition , as the host of the Elven Goddess Mythal. Flemeth is also one of the most powerful shapeshifters to feature in the Dragon Age franchise, with access to an extremely powerful dragon shape.

1 Solas/Fen'Harel

The Dread Wolf

First encountered during Dragon Age: Inquisition , Solas is an often prickly elven mage who assists the Inquisition and its head, the player character, in their attempts to fix the problems plaguing Thedas over the course of the game. In this, Solas is quite effective and can become a key part of the player's team - even able to be romanced by a female Dalish Inquisitor.

In the game, Solas doesn't change his shape, but it's revealed that Solas is none other than the Elven God, Fen'Harel. During the time of Elvhenan it was said that elves and spirits could freely change shapes, and Fen'Harel is strongly associated with wolf iconography, suggesting that Solas is - or was once - able to change his shape.
